contentencoded:
It's an odd day for financial markets, with the bond market closed for Columbus Day. But the stock market is open and with no clear path toward re-opening closed parts of the federal government or averting an impact with the federal debt ceiling, the mood is subdued on stock markets.

For a traffic report on the Washington gridlock, Marketplace Morning Report turns to Stan Collendar, a former House and Senate budget committee staffer who writes about the federal budget -- even when the global financial system may not be at stake.
title: Uncertainty over debt ceiling hits markets
teaser: A weak start on Wall Street with the federal budget and the future of federal borrowing still unresolved.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, October 14, 2013
